snippet: After Ivan Nova allowed two runs in seven innings, Dave Robertson loaded the bases in the ninth but escaped the jam to cap a 5-3 victory over the Rays.
abstract: New York Yankees defeat Tampa Bay Rays, 5-3; Yankees closer Dave Robertson, who is replacing injured Mariano Rivera, earns his first save of the season. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: For more than a decade, the fiery guitar licks and pounding drums of Metallica's ''Enter Sandman'' were synonymous with winning in the ears of Yankees fans. But on Tuesday night, that heavy metal anthem was replaced in the ninth inning by the Southern finger pickings of ''Sweet Home Alabama,'' the Lynyrd Skynyrd classic that signified a changing of the guard, for at least this year. ''Enter Sandman'' was the tune that blared across Yankee Stadium when Mariano Rivera jogged in from the bullpen in save situations. But Rivera is gone for the season with a torn anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee, replaced, at least for now, by the Alabama native Dave Robertson.

headline.main: Heir to Rivera Hangs On to Pass His First Test
